        public void invalidateParent()
        Invalidates cached information about the parent view.

        You must call this method after adding or removing items from the parent view.

      • invalidateItem

        public void invalidateItem(T item)
        Invalidates cached information for a particular item.

        You must call this method when any of the properties set in populateNodeForItem(Object, AccessibilityNodeInfoCompat) have changed.

        Parameters:
        item -

      • sendEventForItem

        public boolean sendEventForItem(T item,
                       int eventType)
        Populates an event of the specified type with information about an item and attempts to send it up through the view hierarchy.
        Parameters:
        item - The item for which to send an event.
        eventType - The type of event to send.
        Returns:
        true if the event was sent successfully.

      • performActionForItem

        protected abstract boolean performActionForItem(T item,
                           int action,
                           android.os.Bundle arguments)
        Performs an accessibility action on the specified item. See AccessibilityNodeInfoCompat.performAction(int, Bundle).

        The helper class automatically handles focus management resulting from AccessibilityNodeInfoCompat.ACTION_ACCESSIBILITY_FOCUS and AccessibilityNodeInfoCompat.ACTION_CLEAR_ACCESSIBILITY_FOCUS, so typically a developer only needs to handle actions added manually in the {populateNodeForItem(Object, AccessibilityNodeInfoCompat) method.

        Parameters:
        item - The item on which to perform the action.
        action - The accessibility action to perform.
        arguments - Arguments for the action, or optionally null.
        Returns:
        true if the action was performed successfully.

      • populateEventForItem

        protected abstract void populateEventForItem(T item,
                        android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEvent event)
        Populates an event with information about the specified item.

        At a minimum, a developer must populate the event text by doing one of the following:

        • appending text to AccessibilityRecord.getText()
        • populating a description with AccessibilityRecord.setContentDescription(CharSequence)

        Parameters:
        item - The item for which to populate the event.
        event - The event to populate.

      • populateNodeForItem

        protected abstract void populateNodeForItem(T item,
                       android.support.v4.view.accessibility.AccessibilityNodeInfoCompat node)
        Populates a node with information about the specified item.

        At a minimum, a developer must:

        • populate the event text using AccessibilityNodeInfoCompat.setText(CharSequence) or AccessibilityNodeInfoCompat.setContentDescription(CharSequence)
        • set the item's parent-relative bounds using AccessibilityNodeInfoCompat.setBoundsInParent(Rect)
        Parameters:
        item - The item for which to populate the node.
        node - The node to populate.

      • getVisibleItems

        protected abstract void getVisibleItems(java.util.List<T> items)
        Populates a list with the parent view's visible items.

        The result of this method is cached until the developer calls invalidateParent().

        Parameters:
        items - The list to populate with visible items.

      • getItemAt

        protected abstract T getItemAt(float x,
          float y)
        Returns the item under the specified parent-relative coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - The parent-relative x coordinate.
        y - The parent-relative y coordinate.
        Returns:
        The item under coordinates (x,y).

      • getIdForItem

        protected abstract int getIdForItem(T item)
        Returns the unique identifier for an item. If the specified item does not exist, returns INVALID_ID.

        This result of this method must be consistent with getItemForId(int).

        Parameters:
        item - The item whose identifier to return.
        Returns:
        A unique identifier, or INVALID_ID.

      • getItemForId

        protected abstract T getItemForId(int id)
        Returns the item for a unique identifier. If the specified item does not exist, returns null.
        Parameters:
        id - The identifier for the item to return.
        Returns:
        An item, or null.
